meanings.definition: A finishing stroke; anything that effectually ends or settles
meanings.sent1: The final quietuses of the story left the readers satisfied.
meanings.sent2: The detective's discovery was the quietuses that solved the case.
meanings.sent3: The quietuses of the argument was when they both realized they were wrong.
meanings.sent4: The quietuses of the marathon was crossing the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The quietuses of the concert was the grand finale with fireworks.

meanings.definition: A discharge or release from life
meanings.sent1: The soldier's quietuses was a peaceful passing in his sleep.
meanings.sent2: The old dog's quietuses was a gentle goodbye in the arms of his owner.
meanings.sent3: The cat's quietuses was when it peacefully napped in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The bird's quietuses was a graceful flight into the sunset.
meanings.sent5: The flower's quietuses was a gentle wilting in the autumn breeze.

meanings.definition: A period of retirement or inactivity
meanings.sent1: After years of hard work, the quietuses of retirement finally arrived.
meanings.sent2: The quietuses of the weekend was spent lounging in pajamas.
meanings.sent3: The quietuses of the vacation was a lazy day by the pool.
meanings.sent4: The quietuses of the evening was a peaceful walk under the stars.
meanings.sent5: The quietuses of the holiday was a cozy day by the fireplace.
